maml:description.maml:para: Gets the key credentials for an application.
The Get-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential cmdlet gets the key credentials for an application.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory for which to get key credentials
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory for which to get key credentials

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get key credentials
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential -ObjectId "3ddd22e7-a150-4bb3-b100-e410dea1cb84"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the key credentials for the specified application.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the logo of an application
This cmdlet retrieves the logo that is set for an application.

maml:Description.maml:para: If provided, the application logo is copied to the file who's name is provided in this parameter
If provided, the application logo is copied with a random filename to the file path that is specified in this parameter
The ObjectID of the application for which the logo is to be retrieved
If set to $true, the application's logo is displayed in a new window on the screen.
If provided, the application logo is copied to the file who's name is provided in this parameter
If provided, the application logo is copied with a random filename to the file path that is specified in this parameter
The ObjectID of the application for which the logo is to be retrieved
If set to $true, the application's logo is displayed in a new window on the screen.

maml:description.maml:para: System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: Example 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to retrieve the application logo for an application that is specified through the Object ID parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the password credential for an application.
The Get-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential cmdlet gets the password credentials for an Azure Active Directory application.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
The objectID of the application for which to get the password credential
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
The objectID of the application for which to get the password credential

command:example.maml:title: Example 1:
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential -ObjectId 3ddd22e7-a150-4bb3-b100-e410dea1cb84
CustomKeyIdentifier : EndDate : 9/28/2017 3:57:10 PM KeyId : StartDate : 9/28/2016 3:57:10 PM Value : SAMPLE_KEY_VALUE

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the thumbnail photo of a contact
Retrieves the thumbnail photo of a contact

maml:Description.maml:para: When provided, the cmdlet will write a copy of the thumbnail photo to this filename
When provided, the cmdlet will write a copy of the thumbnail photo to this file path using a random filename
The object ID of the contact for which the thumbnail photo is retrieved
If this parameter value is set to $Ture, display the retrieved thumbnail poto in a new window
When provided, the cmdlet will write a copy of the thumbnail photo to this filename
When provided, the cmdlet will write a copy of the thumbnail photo to this file path using a random filename
The object ID of the contact for which the thumbnail photo is retrieved
If this parameter value is set to $Ture, display the retrieved thumbnail poto in a new window

maml:description.maml:para: System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: Example 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the thumbnail photo of the contact object specified with the object ID parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Get key credentials for a service principal.
The Get-AzureADServicePrincipalKeyCredential cmdlet gets the key credentials for a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the application for which to get the password credential.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the application for which to get the password credential.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve the key credential of a service principal
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ServicePrincipalId = (Get-AzureADServicePrincipal -Top 1).ObjectId PS C:\> Get-AzureADServicePrincipalKeyCredential -ObjectId $ServicePrincipalId

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ID of a service principal by using the Get-AzureADServicePrincipal (./Get-AzureADServicePrincipal.md)cmdlet. The command stores the ID in the $ServicePrincipalId variable.
The second command gets the key credential for the service principal identified by $ServicePrincipalId.

maml:description.maml:para: Get credentials for a service principal.
The Get-AzureADServicePrincipalPasswordCredential cmdlet gets the password credentials for a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the service principal for which to get password credentials.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the service principal for which to get password credentials.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve the password credential of a service principal
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ServicePrincipalId = (Get-AzureADServicePrincipal -Top 1).ObjectId PS C:\> Get-AzureADServicePrincipalPasswordCredential -ObjectId $ServicePrincipalId

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ID of a service principal by using the Get-AzureADServicePrincipal (./Get-AzureADServicePrincipal.md)cmdlet. The command stores the ID in the $ServicePrincipalId variable.
The second command gets the password credential of a service principal identified by $ServicePrincipalId.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the trusted certificate authority.
The Get-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority cmdlet gets the trusted certificate authority in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory based on TrustedIssuer
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority -TrustedIssuer "CN=example.azure.com, O=MSIT. Ltd, L=Redmond, C=US"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory based on TrustedIssuer.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory based on TrustedIssuerSki
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority -TrustedIssuerSki 4BA2D7AC2A5DF47C70E19E61EDFB4E62B3BF67FD

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieve the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory based on TrustedIssuerSki.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: Online help and examples for working with certificate authority

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a user extension.
The Get-AzureADUserExtension cmdlet gets a user extension in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of an object.
Specifies the ID of an object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve extension attributes for a user
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $UserId = (Get-AzureADUser -Top 1).ObjectId PS C:\> Get-AzureADUserExtension -ObjectId $UserId
Key Value --- ----- odata.metadata https://graph.windows.net/85b5ff1e-0402-400c-9e3c0f9e965325d1$metadata#directoryObjects/Microsoft.Director... odata.type Microsoft.DirectoryServices.User deletionTimestamps signInNames [] companyName creationType facsimileTelephoneNumber isCompromised refreshTokensValidFromDateTime 11/7/2016 10:11:09 PM showInAddressList

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ID of an Azure AD user by using the Get-AzureADUser (./Get-AzureADUser.md)cmdlet. The command stores the value in the $UserId variable.
The second command retrieves all extension attributes that have a value assigned to them for the user identified by $UserId.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the thumbnail photo of a user
Retrieve the thumbnail photo of a user

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified, a copy of the thumbnail photo is written to the specified file name
If specified, a copy of the thumbnail photo is written to the specified file path with a random name
The object ID of the user for which the thumbnail photo is retrieved
If true, view the photo on the screen in a new window
If specified, a copy of the thumbnail photo is written to the specified file name
If specified, a copy of the thumbnail photo is written to the specified file path with a random name
The object ID of the user for which the thumbnail photo is retrieved
If true, view the photo on the screen in a new window

maml:description.maml:para: System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: Example 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to retrieve the thumbnail photo of a user that is specified through the value of the ObejctId parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a key credential for an application.
The New-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential cmdlet creates a key credential for an application.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the time when the key becomes invalid as a DateTime object.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies the time when the key becomes valid as a DateTime object.
Specifies the type of the key.
Specifies the value for the key.
Specifies the time when the key becomes invalid as a DateTime object.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies the time when the key becomes valid as a DateTime object.
Specifies the type of the key.
Specifies the value for the key.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a new application key credential
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $AppID = (Get-AzureADApplication -Top 1).Objectid PS C:\> New-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential -ObjectId $AppId -CustomKeyIdentifier "Test" -StartDate "11/7/2016" -Type "Symmetric" -Usage "Sign" -Value "123"
CustomKeyIdentifier : {84, 101, 115, 116} EndDate : 11/7/2017 12:00:00 AM KeyId : a5845538-3f67-402d-a03e-36d768f1441e StartDate : 11/7/2016 12:00:00 AM Type : Symmetric Usage : Sign Value : {49, 50, 51}

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ID of an application by using the Get-AzureADApplication (./Get-AzureADApplication.md)cmdlet. The command stores it in the $AppId variable.
The second command creates the application key credential for the application identified by $AppId.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Use a certificate to add an application key credential
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $cer = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 #create a new certificate object PS C:\> $cer.Import("C:\Users\PFuller\Desktop\abc.cer") PS C:\> $bin = $cer.GetRawCertData() PS C:\> $base64Value = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($bin) PS C:\> $bin = $cer.GetCertHash() PS C:\> $base64Thumbprint = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($bin) PS C:\> $keyid = [System.Guid]::NewGuid().ToString() PS C:\> New-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential -ObjectId 009d786a-3503-4217-b8ab-db03d71c179a -CustomKeyIdentifier $base64Thumbprint -Type AsymmetricX509Cert -Usage Verify -Value $base64Value -StartDate $cer.GetEffectiveDateString() -EndDate cer.GetExpirationDateString()

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first seven commands create values for the application key credential and stores them in variables.
The final command uses a certificate to add an application key credential.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: This cmdlet uses the ADAL library in Azure Active Directory. To learn more about ADAL, please follow this link:

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a password credential for an application.
The New-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential cmdlet creates a password credential for an application in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of a user in Azure AD.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of a user in Azure AD.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a password credential
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>New-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential -ObjectId "3ddd22e7-a150-4bb3-b100-e410dea1cb84"
CustomKeyIdentifier : EndDate : 9/28/2017 3:57:10 PM KeyId : StartDate : 9/28/2016 3:57:10 PM Value : SAMPLE_KEY_VALUE

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new key credential for a service principal
The New-AzureADServicePrincipalKeyCredential cmdlet creates a key credential for a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a key credential
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureADServicePrincipalKeyCredential

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a key credential for a service principal.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a password credential for a service principal.
The New-AzureADServicePrincipalPasswordCredential cmdlet creates a password credential for a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a trusted certificate authority.
The New-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority cmdlet creates a trusted certificate authority in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Creates the trusted certificate authorities in your directory
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $new_ca = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.CertificateAuthorityInformation #Create CertificateAuthorityInformation object PS C:\> $new_ca.AuthorityType = "RootAuthority" PS C:\> $new_ca.CrlDistributionPoint = "https://example.crl" PS C:\> $new_ca.DeltaCrlDistributionPoint = "https://deltaexample.crl" PS C:\> $new_ca.TrustedCertificate = "Path to .cer file(including cer file name)" PS C:\> New-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority -CertificateAuthorityInformation $new_ca

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the trusted certificate authorities in your directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a key credential from an application.
The Remove-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential cmdlet removes a key credential from an application.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies a unique ID of an application in Azure Active Directory.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a key credential
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureADApplicationKeyCredential -ObjectId "3ddd22e7-a150-4bb3-b100-e410dea1cb84" -KeyId "6aa971c6-3040-45df-87ed-581c8c09ff2b"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the specified key credential from the specified application.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a password credential from an application.
The Remove-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential cmdlet removes a password credential from an application in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the application in Azure AD.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the application in Azure AD.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove an application password credential
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $AppID = (Get-AzureADApplication -Top 1).objectId PS C:\> $KeyIDs = Get-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential -ObjectId $AppId PS C:\> Remove-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential -ObjectId $AppId -KeyId $KeyIds[0].KeyId

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ID of an application by using the Get-AzureADApplication (./Get-AzureADApplication.md)cmdlet, and then stores it in the $AppID variable.

The second command gets the password credential for the application identified by $AppID by using the Get-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential (./ Get-AzureADApplicationPasswordCredential.md)cmdlet. The command stores it in the $KeyId variable.
The final command removes the application password credential for the application identified by $AppID.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a key credential from a service principal.
The Remove-AzureADServicePrincipalKeyCredential cmdlet removes a key credential from a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of a key credential.
Specifies the ID of a service principal.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of a key credential.
Specifies the ID of a service principal.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a password credential from a service principal.
The Remove-AzureADServicePrincipalPasswordCredential cmdlet removes a password credential from a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of an application in Azure AD.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of an application in Azure AD.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a trusted certificate authority.
The Remove-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority cmdlet removes a trusted certificate authority from Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $cer = Get-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority #Get the CertificateAuthorityInformation object PS C:\> Remove-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority -CertificateAuthorityInformation $cer[0]

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deletes the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a user extension.
The Remove-AzureADUserExtension cmdlet removes a user extension from Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of an extension.
Specifies an array of extension names.
Specifies the name of an extension.
Specifies an array of extension names.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the logo for an Application
This cmdlet is used to set the logo for an application

maml:Description.maml:para: The file path of the file that is to be uploaded as the application logo
The ObjectID of the Application for which the logo is set
A fileStream that is to be used as the application logo
The ObjectID of the Application for which the logo is set
And ImageByteArray that is to be used as the application logo
The ObjectID of the Application for which the logo is set
The file path of the file that is to be uploaded as the application logo
A fileStream that is to be used as the application logo
And ImageByteArray that is to be used as the application logo
The ObjectID of the Application for which the logo is set

maml:description.maml:para: System.IO.Stream System.Byte[]

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Set-AzureADApplicationLogo -ObjectId 79592454-dea7-4660-9d91-f1768e5055ac -FilePath D:\applogo.jpg

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet sets the application logo for the application specified by the the ObjectID parameter to the image specified with the FIlepath parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a trusted certificate authority.
The Set-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority cmdlet updates a trusted certificate authority in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Updates the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $cer = Set-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority #Get the CertificateAuthorityInformation object PS C:\> $cer[0].CrlDistributionPoint = "https://example.crl" PS C:\> Set-AzureADTrustedCertificateAuthority -CertificateAuthorityInformation $cer[0]

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the trusted certificate authorities that are defined in your directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets a user extension.
The Set-AzureADUserExtension cmdlet sets a user extension in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of an extension.
Specifies the ID of an object.
Specifies the ID of an object.
Specifies the name of an extension.
Specifies the ID of an object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the value of an extension attribute for a user
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $User = Get-AzureADUser -Top 1 PS C:\> Set-AzureADUserExtension -ObjectId $User.ObjectId -ExtensionName extension_e5e29b8a85d941eab8d12162bd004528_extensionAttribute8 -ExtensionValue "New Value"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets a user by using the Get-AzureADUser (./Get-AzureADUser.md)cmdlet, and then stores it in the $User variable.

The second command sets the value of the extension attribute that hast he specified name to the value New Value. You can get extension attribute names by using the Get-AzureAdExtensionProperty (./Get-AzureAdExtensionProperty.md)cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the password of a user.
The Set-AzureADUserPassword cmdlet sets the password for a user in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: If set to true, force the user to change their password
Forces a user to change their password during their next log in.
Specifies the ID of an object.
If set to true, force the user to change their password
Forces a user to change their password during their next log in.
Specifies the ID of an object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set a user's password
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureADUserPassword -ObjectId "df19e8e6-2ad7-453e-87f5-037f6529ae16" -Password $password

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the specified user's password.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the thumbnail photo for a user
This cmdlet is used to set the thumbnail photo for a user

maml:Description.maml:para: The file path of the image to be uploaded as the user thumbnail photo
The Object ID of the user for which the user thumbnail photo is set
A filestream that contains the user thumbnail photo
The Object ID of the user for which the user thumbnail photo is set
An Image Byte Array that contains the user thumbnail photo
The Object ID of the user for which the user thumbnail photo is set
The file path of the image to be uploaded as the user thumbnail photo
A filestream that contains the user thumbnail photo
An Image Byte Array that contains the user thumbnail photo
The Object ID of the user for which the user thumbnail photo is set

maml:description.maml:para: System.IO.Stream System.Byte[]

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Set-AzureADUserThumbnailPhoto -ObjectId ba6752c4-6a2e-4be5-a23d-67d8d5980796 -FilePath D:\UserThumbnailPhoto.jpg

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the thumbnail photo of the user specified witht eh PObjectId parameter to the image specified with the FilePath parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the password for the signed-in user.
The Update-AzureADSignedInUserPassword cmdlet updates the password for the signed-in user in Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the current password of the signed-in user.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the new password for the signed-in user.
Specifies the current password of the signed-in user.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the new password for the signed-in user.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a password
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Update-AzureADSignedInUserPassword -CurrentPassword $CurrentPassword -NewPassword $NewPassword

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the password for the signed-in user.
